page.title: 16FARMING _ SOUTH ASHFORD
page.content: The greater part of the farming land, adjoins the river area. This flood plain area has been used for rough pasture land, mainly sheep grazing, some store cattle fattening, a little dairy herd work and one or two fields used for horses. Many larger houses have small paddocks alongside. Part of this area was used as an emergency airfield during World War II and had American Bombers based locally. South & West shows some slow rise and very gentle hills, the highest being Colliers Hill, 74m above sea level. There are knolls of woodland, but no extensive woodland. Between the clumps of woodland this marginally better drained land is used for grain crops, wheat & barley mainly and a few single fields of potatoes and broad beans.
